unnormalised: **Yoga Practices: My Journey from Stiffness to Serenity**
normalised: **Yoga Practices: My Journey from Stiffness to Serenity**

unnormalised: So, I've been practicing yoga seriously for the past 2 years now, and honestly, it's been a game-changer in my lifestyle. Before, I used to think yoga was just stretching, something my aunt, Radha aunty, did after her 60th birthday on 26/01/2020. How wrong I was!
normalised: So, I've been practicing yoga seriously for the past two years now, and honestly, it's been a game-changer in my lifestyle. Before, I used to think yoga was just stretching, something my aunt, Radha aunty, did after her sixtieth birthday on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty. How wrong I was!

unnormalised: My journey started with some beginner classes near my home in Bangalore. My back was always stiff from working at a desk at TCS all day, from 09:00 hrs to 17:00 hrs. I remember the first class; I could barely touch my toes! The instructor, Priya, was incredibly patient. She emphasized proper alignment and breathing techniques – things I never considered before.
normalised: My journey started with some beginner classes near my home in Bangalore. unnormalised: Slowly, I started noticing a difference. My back pain subsided, I felt more energetic, and even my sleep improved. Now, I can hold a plank for a respectable time, and I'm working on my Sirsasana (headstand), though I still need a wall for support!
normalised: Slowly, I started noticing a difference. My back pain subsided, I felt more energetic, and even my sleep improved. Now, I can hold a plank for a respectable time, and I'm working on my Sirsasana (headstand), though I still need a wall for support!

unnormalised: Besides the physical benefits, yoga has also helped me manage stress. The Pranayama (breathing exercises) are particularly effective. Whenever I feel overwhelmed, I just take 5 minutes for some deep breathing, and it centers me.
normalised: Besides the physical benefits, yoga has also helped me manage stress. The Pranayama (breathing exercises) are particularly effective. Whenever I feel overwhelmed, I just take five minutes for some deep breathing, and it centers me.

unnormalised: I now practice every morning before work. It sets the tone for the day, and I truly believe it's made me a happier and healthier person. If you're considering starting yoga, I highly recommend it. Even a few minutes a day can make a world of difference. Find a good teacher, listen to your body, and be patient. The journey is worth it! I took a class at the Sivananda Ashram on 15/08/2022, and that really helped me deepen my practice.
